title.narrative: General Education Quality Improvement Project - APL 1 (GEQIP)

description.narrative: The development objective of the Program is to improve the quality of general education (Grades 1-12) throughout the country. The development objectives of Phase 1 of the GEQIP (2009-2013) are to: (i) improve teaching and learning conditions in primary and secondary education; and (ii) improve management planning and budget capacity of the Ministry of Education and Regional Bureaus of Education.

condition.narrative: Act promptly and diligently in order to take all measures required to ensure efficient completion of Project and achievement ofprogram objectives, based on conclusions and recommendations of report
No later than April 1, 2011, carry out jointly with Association and Contributing Partners a mid-term review, which shall cover (i)overall implementation progress and (ii) results of M&E activities
No later than one month before the mid-term review, furnish to Association an implmentation report describing achievement ofprogram objectives, including action to deal with potential deficiencies
Recipient shall appoint an independent auditor, pursuant to the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) of the General Conditions
Recipient shall by not later than December 1, 2009, furnish the Association and Contributing Partners with a progress report oftheProject during EFY 2001, to be repeated each year
Recipient shall have its Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) of the GeneralConditions, covering the period of one Ethiopian fiscal year
Recipient shall prepare Project Reports covering six months of Ethiopian fiscal year and furnish to Association and ContributingPartners no later than 75 days after end of period covered by report.
Recipient shall prepare and furnish the Association not later than 75 days after the end of each fiscal quarter, interim unauditedfinancial reports covering the quarter

title.narrative: % of teachers with appropriate qualifications (Diploma or degree) in G1-4, G5-8, and G9-12

comment.narrative: Source: ESAA 2006/07
End target updated. PAD targets were: G1-4: 15.7; G5-8: 56.0; G9-12: 70.0. ESDP does not disaggregate the indicator by the cyclefor primary education.
Based on Educational Statistics Annual Abstract (ESAA) 2011/12.
Source: ESAA 2006/07
End targets from ESDP IV. Targets surpassed.
Source: ESAA 2011/12
Source: ESAA 2006/07. Enrollment of grade 1 to 12.
Number of female - 8,712,335 (47.6%).Source: ESAA 2010/11

title.narrative: General education expenditure as % of total education budget

comment.narrative: The baseline for 2006/07 corrected to 52.6% from 66.6%.
Official policy does not exist. End target revised during the MTR from 66.6% to 52.6% (baseline level).
Data for 2011/12; Estimated using information from ESAA 2011-12, and MOFED data based on information available for 7 of the 11regions and also excluding federal expenditure.

title.narrative: Education expenditure as % of total government budget

comment.narrative: The baseline of 15.3% for 2006/07 corrected to 21.4%.
End target was revised to 25.4% at MTR. But no official policy exists. Therefore, the end target again revised to the baselinelevel. The PAD target was 14.5%.
Source ESAA 2011/12

title.narrative: Recurrent non-salary expenditures as % of general education budget for each region

comment.narrative: The baseline of 5% for 2006/07 corrected to 9.0%.
End target was revised from 5% at MTR.
Estimated using information from ESAA 2011-12. Only reported for 7 of the 11 regions.Tigray:47.2%Afar: 7.2%Amhara:2.4%Oromiya:1.8%Benshengul Gummuz: 4.9%Harari: 4.9%Dire Dawa: 22.2%

Component 1: Number of cumulative textbooks and teacher guides in core subjects distributed in (a) primary and (b) secondary (math and science; other core subjects)

baseline.value: Primary core - none; Secondary math and science - none;Secondary other core subjects - none

target.value: Primary core - 76.7 million; Secondary math and science - 4.2 million; Secondary other core subjects - 7.3 million

title.narrative: Pupil to new textbook ratio in core subjects in a) Primary (including ABE centers) & b) Secondary (math and science & other core subjects)

baseline.value: Primary core subjects - none; Secondary math and science - none; Secondary other core subjects - none

target.value: Primary core subjects - 1:1; Secondary math and science - 1:1; Secondary other core subjects - 1:1

actual.value: 1.2:1 for most printed core textbooks - Calculated based on the number of textbooks distributed and the number of students for2012/13.

comment.narrative: More books are being delivered. Detailed breakdown will be available for the ICR
